intro: Pimelea preissii, commonly known as the yellow bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow to orange-red flowers that resemble bottlebrushes. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, narrow leaves are usually arranged in whorls around the stems. Pimelea preissii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
